Then the fans returned the favor with raucous ovations he won't soon forget. That's when you get the goose bumps, Allen Iverson said.`` You honestly don't really feel it when the Robert Horrys are going down. You don't ever get the goose bumps until the fans start to appreciate what you're doing out there.''

This clash of the tech titans is captured by POLITICO's Elizabeth Wasserman in a slice of the type of reporting you can expect from POLITICO Pro. Google is under siege in Washington like never before- and it says an` anti-Google industrial complex' is to blame. In an interview with POLITICO, a Google spokesman argued that a cabal of antitrust Jude Lawyers, lobbyists and public relations firms is conspiring against the Internet search giant. The mastermind? Google says it's Microsoft, Wasserman reports.`` Maybe it's iRon Kirky, or maybe it's payback. Andy Coulson one degree of separation to the McCann affair: McCann family spokesman Clarence Mitchell joins CCHQ as head of media monitoring for the election www.prweek.com PR Week has the story: The Conservative Party has signed up Clarence Mitchell , best-known as spokesman for Madeleine McCann's parents, as the head of media monitoring for its general election campaign, PRWeek can exclusively reveal.`` Clarence Mitchell joins the Tory comms operation today, reporting directly to director of communications Andy Coulson . Clarence Mitchell , who was the director of the Government's media monitoring unit for two years( 2005-2007) will take a back room role, monitoring the progress of the Tories' campaign in the media. She's able to open her eyes and understand and show people she understands what she's hearing and seeing. Gabrielle Giffords began breathing without a ventilator yesterday as doctors took out the breathing tube that had run down her throat and replaced it with a tracheotomy tube in her windpipe. Surgeons also inserted a feeding tube.

It's demeaning, and there's no point to it. We're not looking for a nice person; we're looking for somebody who's confident and assured, but talented above all. Trust me-- most stars aren't nice. 2.
